directoryParameter.name: parent_installdir
directoryParameter.title: Select an output parent directory
directoryParameter.explanation:
This "installer" does not actually install anything. Instead, it guides you through configuring ODK Aggregate. As the last step of the installer, it will either launch the upload tool for uploading to Google's AppEngine cloud services or open a README.html containing the final installation instructions for MySQL or PostgreSQL deployments.
Please select the parent directory under which an 'ODK Aggregate' directory will be created to contain the configured software.

directoryParameter.name: installdir
directoryParameter.description: Hidden value defining the (parent_installdir + aggregate_dir) in which to install files.

choiceParameter.name: platform
choiceParameter.title: Choose Platform
choiceParameter.explanation:
Choose the data storage and execution environment on which you would like ODK Aggregate to run. If you choose MySQL, PostgreSQL or Microsoft SQL Server (or Microsoft Azure SQL Server), you will need to first install that database server and an Apache Tomcat 8 webserver.
NOTE: If you want to use the Microsoft Azure SQL Server, you must configure Tomcat 8 to use Java 8.

option.description: Uses a MySQL database and an Apache Tomcat 8 webserver that you install.
Uses a PostgreSQL database and an Apache Tomcat 8 webserver that you install.
Uses a Microsoft SQL Server or Azure SQL Server database and an Apache Tomcat 8 webserver that you install.

linkParameter.name: infoUpgradingTov2
linkParameter.title: Pre-installation Requirements - Upgrading from Aggregate v1.x
linkParameter.explanation: If you are upgrading from Aggregate v1.x and you are using Google account credentials, please migrate those credentials to ODK accounts before proceeding with the installation. Google credentials are no longer supported and cannot be used to log into Aggregate v2.x.

linkParameter.name: infoTomcat
linkParameter.title: Pre-installation Requirements - Apache Tomcat
linkParameter.explanation:
Before continuing, you should download and install an Apache Tomcat 8 webserver within which you will run ODK Aggregate (instructions on installing your chosen database will be presented later).
Apache Tomcat 8 can be downloaded from the link below.
If you modify any of the Apache Tomcat defaults, please make note of them.
NOTE: If you want to use the Microsoft Azure SQL Server, you must configure Tomcat 8 to use Java 8.

parameterGroup.name: tomcat_authentication_info
parameterGroup.title: Apache Tomcat SSL configuration
parameterGroup.explanation:
SSL certificates allow a client to verify the identity of a webserver and to establish secured (encrypted) communications with that webserver (https:). SSL certificates are typically purchased from Verisign or another issuing authority; that process can take weeks to complete.
If you do have an SSL certificate, please refer to the Apache Tomcat documentation for how to install the certificate on your system. Within the Tomcat 8.0 documentation, refer to the User Guide section 12: SSL.

parameterGroup.name: tomcat_port_choice
parameterGroup.title: Apache Tomcat Port Configuration
parameterGroup.explanation:
ODK Aggregate needs to know the port numbers and the Internet-visible IP address or DNS name through which it can be reached in order to construct links back to its content when publishing or exporting data files.
Follow the ODK Aggregate Tomcat Install instructions (link below) to make your computer accessible on the web (using an Internet-visible IP address) and to establish a DNS name.

stringParameter.name: hostname
stringParameter.description: Internet-visible IP address or DNS name:

labelParameter.name: hostname_label_optional
labelParameter.explanation: ODK Aggregate will try to resolve an IP address or DNS name for you if you leave this field empty.

labelParameter.name: hostname_label_warning
labelParameter.explanation:
Make sure you provide an IP address or DNS name matching your SSL certificate.
ODK Aggregate will try to resolve an IP address or DNS name for you if you leave this field empty, but this can be unreliable in SSL configurations.

linkParameter.name: infoDatabasePostgreSQL
linkParameter.title: Pre-installation Database Requirements - PostgreSQL
linkParameter.explanation:
We have developed and tested against PostgreSQL 9.0
Download and install PostgreSQL from the link below.
Make note of any non-default values you've entered during the installation process.

linkParameter.name: infoDatabaseSQLServer
linkParameter.title: Pre-installation Database Requirements - Microsoft SQL Server
linkParameter.explanation:
We have developed and tested against Microsft SQL Server 2016 and Azure SQL Server.
Download and install Microsft SQL Server 2016 from the link below or establish an Azure account, create an Azure SQL Server within it, and configure the Azure SQL Server firewall to allow access from your Tomcat server.
NOTE: If you are using Azure SQL Server, you must install and use Java 8 when running Tomcat 8.
It is assumed that Windows authentication will be used when accessing either database.

linkParameter.name: infoDatabaseMySQL
linkParameter.title: Pre-installation Database Requirements - MySQL
linkParameter.explanation:
We have developed and tested against MySQL 5.1 and 5.5
Please download, install and configure MySQL from the link below.
Choose the Downloads (GA) tab, and select the MySQL Community Server edition. When running the MySQL Server Instance Configuration Wizard, please make note of your root password and any non-default values you have entered during the installation process.

linkParameter.name: infoDatabaseMySQL2
linkParameter.title: Pre-installation Database Requirements - MySQL (concluded)
linkParameter.explanation:
You also must install a MySQL library on the Apache Tomcat instance. Please download the MySQL Connector/J zip file from the link below.
Unzip or extract the contents of this file to a directory on your system. The top-level directory should contain a file named:
mysql-connector-java-...-bin.jar
Copy this file into the /lib directory of your Apache Tomcat 8 installation. On Windows, the default location for this is 'C:\Program Files\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat 8.0\lib'
Stop and restart your Apache webserver (so it can discover this new library).

parameterGroup.name: database_server_config
parameterGroup.title: Database server settings
parameterGroup.explanation:
Specify the host and port number used to communicate with the database server.
If the database server is on the same host as the webserver, enter '127.0.0.1'

parameterGroup.name: database_config_part_1
parameterGroup.title: ODK Aggregate database authentication settings
parameterGroup.explanation:
The database server must be configured with an account (username and password) that ODK Aggregate will employ for accessing the database server. This is not an account that you will give to anyone; it is only for use by the ODK Aggregate webserver. Username and password should be alphanumeric strings beginning with a letter (no spaces or punctuation please!).
The installer will generate a script that can be run on the database server to establish the required configuration.

parameterGroup.name: database_config_part_2
parameterGroup.title: ODK Aggregate database datastore settings
parameterGroup.explanation:
The database server must be configured with a workspace identified by a database name, and, if using Postgresql, a schema name. This workspace is where ODK Aggregate will store uploaded forms, submissions and other information. The database name (and schema name for Postgresql) can be any alphanumeric strings beginning with a letter; underscores (_) are OK (no spaces or punctuation please!).
The installer will generate a script that can be run on the database server to create the workspace.

parameterGroup.name: database_config_sqlserver_1
parameterGroup.title: ODK Aggregate database datastore settings
parameterGroup.explanation:
A database and schema must be created on the Microsoft SQL Server database server. All uploaded forms, submissions and other information will be stored in this schema within this database. The database name (and schema name) can be any alphanumeric strings beginning with a letter; underscores (_) are OK (no spaces or punctuation please!). The installer will generate a script that can be run on the database server to create the database.
The Windows user or group will be granted the permissions to manage and write into this schema.

stringParameter.name: jdbc_sqlserver_username
stringParameter.description: Windows user or group with database access:
stringParameter.explanation: Enter the Domain\Username or group that the Tomcat 8 server will run as and use to access the database.

parameterGroup.name: database_config_sqlserver_2
parameterGroup.title: ODK Aggregate database datastore settings
parameterGroup.explanation: The Microsoft SQL Server and Azure SQL Server database driver requires that you specify the full JDBC URL for accessing this database. See Microsoft documentation for how to construct this URL.

stringParameter.name: instance_display_name
stringParameter.title: ODK Aggregate Instance Name
stringParameter.description: Please enter the name of your instance:
stringParameter.explanation:
The ODK Aggregate instance name will be displayed to your users when they log into ODK Aggregate using their ODK Aggregate username and password. Including the name of your organization in the instance name can help users confirm that they have contacted the correct website.
NOTE: During subsequent upgrades, any changes to this text will invalidate all the ODK Aggregate passwords configured on your webserver. To prevent disruptions during upgrades, please make a record of the name you have chosen.

stringParameter.name: username
stringParameter.title: Super-user ODK Aggregate Username
stringParameter.description: Please enter an ODK Aggregate Username:
stringParameter.explanation:
The user with this account will always have full permissions on the system.
The first time ODK Aggregate runs, only this user is allowed to log onto the system. Upon first logging in, they should change their password and complete the configuration of ODK Aggregate by specifying additional users and what permissions those users have on the system. This user's password will be set to 'aggregate' upon initial install or upon changing the ODK Aggregate instance name.

throwError.text: Bad username. Please enter a name starting with a letter and containing only letters and numbers.
